Package FOMS.order_manager

Class Order

  • java.lang.Object
    • FOMS.order_manager.Order
  • public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
    The Order class represents an order within FOMS. It maintains the order details including items in the order, total cost, order status, and order type. This class also handles the timing for order readiness and automatically cancels orders that are not collected within a certain timeframe.

    Orders can have statuses such as "New", "Ready for Pickup", and "Completed". The class provides methods to add items to the order, calculate the total cost, manage order status, and initiate a cancellation timer for uncollected orders.

    Since:
    2024-04-24

    • Constructor Detail

      • Order

        public Order​(java.lang.String orderId,
             java.lang.String status,
             double total,
             java.lang.String orderType,
             java.util.List<OrderItem> orderItems)
        Constructs an order with specified details. Initializes the order with the given order ID, status, total cost, order type, and list of order items.
        Parameters:
        orderId - The unique identifier for the order.
        status - The current status of the order.
        total - The total cost of the order.
        orderType - The type of the order (e.g., "takeaway", "delivery").
        orderItems - The list of items included in the order.

      • Order

        public Order​(java.lang.String orderId)
        Constructs an order with a default status of "New". This constructor is typically used when an order is being created from scratch.
        Parameters:
        orderId - The unique identifier for the order.

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public void addItem​(OrderItem item)
        Adds an item to the order and recalculates the total cost.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to add to the order.

      • getOrderItems

        public java.util.List<OrderItem> getOrderItems()
        Retrieves the list of OrderItem objects contained within the order. Each OrderItem represents a specific item in the order, including its quantity and any customizations.
        Returns:
        A list of OrderItem objects representing the items in the order.

      • getOrderId

        public java.lang.String getOrderId()
        Retrieves the unique identifier for the order. This ID is used to track and manage the order throughout its lifecycle in the system.
        Returns:
        The string representing the unique order ID.

      • getTotal

        public double getTotal()
        Calculates and returns the total cost of the order. This is computed by summing up the cost of all items in the order, including their quantities.
        Returns:
        The total cost of the order as a double.

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus()
        Retrieves the current status of the order. The status could be "New", "Ready for Pickup", "Completed", or other states defined within the system to track the progress of the order.
        Returns:
        The current status of the order as a string.

      • setOrderType

        public void setOrderType​(java.lang.String orderType)
        Sets the order type (e.g., "takeaway", "delivery"). This defines how the order should be processed in terms of its fulfillment method.
        Parameters:
        orderType - The type of the order as a string.

      • getOrderType

        public java.lang.String getOrderType()
        Retrieves the type of the order. The order type influences how the order is handled by the system, affecting processes such as processing and collection.
        Returns:
        The type of the order as a string.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus​(java.lang.String status)
        Sets the status of the order. If the status is set to "Ready for Pickup", the readiness time is also recorded.
        Parameters:
        status - The new status of the order.

      • getReadyTime

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getReadyTime()
        Returns the date and time when the order was marked as ready for pickup. This is only set when the order status changes to "Ready for Pickup".
        Returns:
        The LocalDateTime when the order was ready, or null if not set.

      • startCancellationTimer

        public void startCancellationTimer​(java.util.List<Order> ordersList,
                                   java.lang.String filename)
        Initiates a timer that will cancel the order if it is not collected within a specified timeout period. This method is intended to be used when an order is marked as ready for pickup.
        Parameters:
        ordersList - The list containing all current orders, used for updating the status in the system.
        filename - The filename where the order statuses are persisted.

      • cancelTimer

        public void cancelTimer()
        Cancels the active cancellation timer if the order has been collected. This is necessary to stop the timer from executing if the order status changes to "Completed" before the timer elapses.
